meanings.definition: Immanentists: Those who believe in the concept of immanence.
meanings.sent1: The immanentists in our class study the idea of immanence.
meanings.sent2: Many immanentists find peace in the belief of divine presence in the world.
meanings.sent3: The immanentists had a picnic to celebrate the concept of immanence.
meanings.sent4: Like detectives, immanentists search for clues of the divine in everyday life.
meanings.sent5: The immanentists' passion for immanence shines brightly in their discussions.

meanings.definition: Immanentists: Followers of the philosophy that emphasizes the presence of the divine within the physical world.
meanings.sent1: As immanentists, they see the divine in every tree and rock.
meanings.sent2: The immanentists' gatherings are filled with discussions on divine presence in the world.
meanings.sent3: The immanentists joked that even their pet cat could be a divine being.
meanings.sent4: The immanentists' hearts beat in rhythm with the pulse of the physical world.
meanings.sent5: In the eyes of immanentists, every flower holds a piece of the divine essence.
